definition: putting on or marked by airs of superiority : arrogant, presumptuous
examples: The truth is I am tired every afternoon and there's nothing to be done about it. It's the nature of the disease. A lot of people decide I am bored or indifferent or uppity but at a certain hour of the day my motor cuts off automatically.

definition: aspiring to a rank or position higher than one deserves or is entitled to
examples: In a seller's market for labor, it seems, there is a danger that the help will get uppity.
… a group of senior male executives referred to my staff of predominantly professional women as uppity.

We talked as long as I dared. She told me to reverse the charges. It was my call, I said. She laughed and said I was getting uppity. I described Mrs. Burgess, how working for her was hardly like being a servant.
Hagar, with child, despised her mistress and flaunted her pregnancy over her. … Sarah flew upon the uppity servant girl and drove her off into the desert.
